node.title: NT records 11 new COVID cases, including one woman infectious in Katherine after leaving hard lockdown
node.alt: NT Chief Minister Michael Gunner talks to the media. His expression is serious.
node.description: The Northern Territory has recorded 11Â new local cases of COVID-19 overnight, Chief Minister Michael Gunner says.
node.content: ["The Northern Territory has recorded 11\u00a0new local cases of COVID-19 overnight, Chief Minister Michael Gunner says.", "The Territory's cluster now stands at 51\u00a0cases.", "Mr Gunner said one of those cases was a woman who \"evaded authorities, left the hard lockdown [in Binjari] and travelled by taxi to Katherine\" with three other people last night.", "\"The result was confirmed this morning,\" he said.", "\"The woman did not know she had COVID-19.\"", "Mr Gunner said the woman was moving around in Katherine while infectious.", "NT Police found the woman about 10 minutes ago, Mr Gunner said on Wednesday morning.", "She was with the three people she left Binjari with, plus seven others.", "All 11 are on their way to the Centre for National Resilience, Mr Gunner said.", "\"The positive case shows why the hard lockdown in Binjari is so critical and why acting illegally to evade the hard lockdown is so dangerous,\"\u00a0Mr Gunner said.", "\"It also shows why the lockdown in Katherine is still so important.\"", "Three of the positive cases are children from the same family.", "One of them is already at the Centre for National Resilience in quarantine with her mother, who is a previous positive case.", "Two other children were in quarantine with their father in Katherine East. They\u00a0have since been transferred to the Centre for National Resilience.", "The other seven cases are all close contacts\u00a0who were already in the Centre for National Resilience.", "Five of them are from the Binjari community, and two are from Robinson River.", "\"Eight tested positive while quarantining at the Centre for National Resilience, two tested positive while quarantining at home in Katherine and one was positive in the community briefly but is now accounted for,\" Mr Gunner said.", "He said the Bicentennial Road catchment in Katherine East was continuing to return COVID-positive wastewater results.", "\"This is to be expected\u00a0as this is where the kids were,\" he said.", "The Katherine Golf Course wastewater has now returned negative results.", "The Rockhole wastewater is negative, which is \"very encouraging\", Mr Gunner said.", "There were 3,519 COVID-19 tests processed yesterday.", "\"This is a huge effort.\u00a0Thank you,\" Mr Gunner said.", "There are now 471 close contacts, of which 462 have been located and are isolating, he said.", "These contacts have returned 433 negative results so far.", "The McDonald's restaurant in Katherine has now been upgraded from a casual contact site to a close contact site for the period between 11am and 11:25am on Saturday, November 13.", "\"This was McHappy Day.\u00a0It was very busy on that Saturday,\" Mr Gunner said.", "\"Investigations have determined that there were four positive cases that were there at the same time, making it very high risk.\"", "People who visited the restaurant during the exposure time must call the COVID hotline and isolate immediately.", "The Katherine Centrelink,\u00a0from 9:44am to 10:36am on November 15, has been downgraded from a close contact site to a casual contact site.", "Anyone who was there at that time must still get tested.", "Mr Gunner said there would \"definitely be new exposure sites\" in the coming days due to the COVID-positive woman who was moving around the community while infectious.", "\"There is plenty of good news as well,\" Mr Gunner said.", "\"Ten of our positive cases are in quarantine. The links are clear and they help explain our positive wastewater results.\"", "Acting Chief Health Officer Charles Pain said a \"significant contact tracing effort\" was underway to identify locations where the COVID-positive case had visited in Katherine after leaving Binjari.", "More to come."]
